alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:43PM MST until July 28 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 242 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Payson, Geronimo Estates, Pine, Flowing Springs, East Verde Estates, Whispering Pines, Freedom Acres, Washington Park, Strawberry, Mesa Del Caballo, Geronimo Boy Scout Camp, Kehl Springs Campground, Beaver Valley, Water Wheel Burn At Houston Mesa Rd-S, Water Wheel Burn At Houston Mesa Rd-N, Tonto Natural Bridge State Park and Houston Mesa Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 near mile marker 240...and between mile markers 247 and 251. State Route 87 between mile markers 255 and 287. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Corduroy Wash, Clover Creek, West Webber Creek, West Clear Creek, Toms Creek and Clear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
